title: Property division in a divorse
question: Im getting divorse and I own a house with my soon to be ex wife. The house top value is 325000 and we own 220000 if we sell it after brokers fees ans escrow we will be dividing 79000 wich maybe I can afford to pay her (half of her profit) but she wants 50000 thinking we owe 220000 and the house could sell for 32500 I need legal advice
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Lawsuits and disputes
answers: Are there other assets or debts to be divided? Suggest that the two of you agree to sell the house and then place the funds, after sale and close of escrow into a blocked account until after division of all assets and debts/liabilities. Also suggest you seek legal assistance so that all credits/reimbursements can probably be accounted for.

If the court orders the house sold and profits split, the fees will reduce both your shares. You can try to reach an agreement, but there may be otber issues. I would suggest that you have a consult with a local divorce attorney to discuss your options. Good luck!
